title: 105_s399
content: The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include a new section 10 for the Environmental Dispute Resolution Fund. The Environmental Dispute Resolution Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to be administered by the Foundation. The Fund will consist of appropriated amounts and payments under specific sections. The Foundation will use the Fund for necessary expenses to operate the Institute, including salaries, administration, mediation services, and other determined expenses. The Fund will be kept separate from the Trust Fund, and any excess amounts will be invested by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Environmental Dispute Resolution Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States and will be administered by the Foundation. The Fund will consist of appropriated amounts and payments under specific sections. Investments in interest-bearing obligations of the United States can be made for the Fund, and any proceeds from these investments will be credited to the Fund. SEC. 11. USE OF THE INSTITUTE BY A FEDERAL AGENCY. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to allow a federal agency to utilize the Institute. A Federal agency can utilize the Foundation and Institute for environmental dispute resolution services. They can enter into contracts and pay for services, with payments going into the Environmental Dispute Resolution Fund. Notification to the President's Council on Environmental Quality is required when using these services. The President's Council on Environmental Quality must be notified when utilizing the Foundation or Institute for environmental dispute resolution services. Notifications should include descriptions of the issues, parties involved, prior efforts, and other relevant information. Concurrence is required in cases involving disputes between federal agencies or instrumentalities. The Federal Government must seek approval from the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality before using the Foundation or Institute for specified services. The chairperson must provide their decision within 20 days of being notified of any disputes or conflicts. SEC. 8. Authorization of appropriations for the Trust Fund and Environmental Dispute Resolution Fund under the Morris K. Udall Scholarship Act. $4,250,000 allocated for fiscal year 1998, with $3,000,000 for capitalization and $1,250,000 for operation costs. $1,250,000 allocated for operation costs for each fiscal year from 1999 to 2002. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to replace "Fund" with "Trust Fund" in various sections. Passed the Senate on October 9, 1997.
